Statement: During discussions of issues I care about I can successfully defend my ideas.
I have many resources to defend my point of view when I feel my ideas are under attack.
When I pay attention to the arguments proposed by people who disagree with me I feel confused and cannot think. (reverse-scored)
When trying to defend my point of view I am not at all articulate. (reverse-scored)
I have developed ways of ’winning’ when I debate issues I care about.
I could stand by my ideas in front of anybody.
No matter what I read or hear I am always capable of defending my feelings and opinions.
I think of myself as somebody who has enough information to defend his or her points of view.
Compared to most people, I am able to maintain my own opinions regardless of what conflicting information I receive.
Compared to people I know who are very successful at maintaining their point of view, I have somewhat weak, underdeveloped opinions. (reverse-scored)
I can defend my points of view when I want to.
I am unable to defend my own opinions successfully. (reverse-scored)
